verses.verse: Wine<WH3196> is a mocker<WH3887>, strong drink<WH7941> is raging<WH1993>: and whosoever is deceived<WH7686> thereby is not wise<WH2449>.
The fear<WH367> of a king<WH4428> is as the roaring<WH5099> of a lion<WH3715>: whoso provoketh him to anger<WH5674> sinneth<WH2398> against his own soul<WH5315>.
It is an honour<WH3519> for a man<WH376> to cease<WH7674> from strife<WH7379>: but every fool<WH191> will be meddling<WH1566>.
The sluggard<WH6102> will not plow<WH2790> by reason of the cold<WH2779>; therefore shall he beg<WH7592> <WH7592> in harvest<WH7105>, and have nothing. cold: or, winter
Counsel<WH6098> in the heart<WH3820> of man<WH376> is like deep<WH6013> water<WH4325>; but a man<WH376> of understanding<WH8394> will draw it out<WH1802>.
Most<WH7230> men<WH120> will proclaim<WH7121> every one<WH376> his own goodness<WH2617>: but a faithful<WH529> man<WH376> who can find<WH4672>? goodness: or, bounty
The just<WH6662> man walketh<WH1980> in his integrity<WH8537>: his children<WH1121> are blessed<WH835> after<WH310> him.
A king<WH4428> that sitteth in<WH3427> the throne<WH3678> of judgment<WH1779> scattereth away<WH2219> all evil<WH7451> with his eyes<WH5869>.
Who can say<WH559>, I have made my heart<WH3820> clean<WH2135>, I am pure<WH2891> from my sin<WH2403>?

Divers weights<WH68> <WH68>, and divers measures<WH374> <WH374>, both<WH8147> of them are alike<WH1571> abomination<WH8441> to the LORD<WH3068>. Divers weights: Heb. A stone and a stone divers measures: Heb. an ephah and an ephah
Even a child<WH5288> is known<WH5234> by his doings<WH4611>, whether his work<WH6467> be pure<WH2134>, and whether it be right<WH3477>.
The hearing<WH8085> ear<WH241>, and the seeing<WH7200> eye<WH5869>, the LORD<WH3068> hath made<WH6213> even both<WH8147> of them.
Love<WH157> not sleep<WH8142>, lest thou come to poverty<WH3423>; open<WH6491> thine eyes<WH5869>, and thou shalt be satisfied<WH7646> with bread<WH3899>.
It is naught<WH7451>, it is naught<WH7451>, saith<WH559> the buyer<WH7069>: but when he is gone<WH235> his way, then he boasteth<WH1984>.
There is<WH3426> gold<WH2091>, and a multitude<WH7230> of rubies<WH6443>: but the lips<WH8193> of knowledge<WH1847> are a precious<WH3366> jewel<WH3627>.
Take<WH3947> his garment<WH899> that is surety<WH6148> for a stranger<WH2114>: and take a pledge<WH2254> of him for a strange woman<WH5237>.
Bread<WH3899> of deceit<WH8267> is sweet<WH6156> to a man<WH376>; but afterwards<WH310> his mouth<WH6310> shall be filled<WH4390> with gravel<WH2687>. deceit: Heb. lying, or, falsehood
Every purpose<WH4284> is established<WH3559> by counsel<WH6098>: and with good advice<WH8458> make<WH6213> war<WH4421>.
He that goeth about<WH1980> as a talebearer<WH7400> revealeth<WH1540> secrets<WH5475>: therefore meddle<WH6148> not with him that flattereth<WH6601> with his lips<WH8193>. flattereth: or, enticeth
Whoso curseth<WH7043> his father<WH1> or his mother<WH517>, his lamp<WH5216> shall be put out<WH1846> in obscure<WH380> <WH380> darkness<WH2822>. lamp: or, candle
An inheritance<WH5159> may be gotten hastily<WH926> <WH973> at the beginning<WH7223>; but the end<WH319> thereof shall not be blessed<WH1288>.
Say<WH559> not thou, I will recompense<WH7999> evil<WH7451>; but wait on<WH6960> the LORD<WH3068>, and he shall save<WH3467> thee.
Divers weights<WH68> <WH68> are an abomination<WH8441> unto the LORD<WH3068>; and a false<WH4820> balance<WH3976> is not good<WH2896>. a false: Heb. balance of deceit
Man's<WH1397> goings<WH4703> are of the LORD<WH3068>; how can a man<WH120> then understand<WH995> his own way<WH1870>?
It is a snare<WH4170> to the man<WH120> who devoureth<WH3216> that which is holy<WH6944>, and after<WH310> vows<WH5088> to make enquiry<WH1239>.
A wise<WH2450> king<WH4428> scattereth<WH2219> the wicked<WH7563>, and bringeth<WH7725> the wheel<WH212> over them.
The spirit<WH5397> of man<WH120> is the candle<WH5216> of the LORD<WH3068>, searching<WH2664> all the inward parts<WH2315> of the belly<WH990>. candle: or, lamp
Mercy<WH2617> and truth<WH571> preserve<WH5341> the king<WH4428>: and his throne<WH3678> is upholden<WH5582> by mercy<WH2617>.
The glory<WH8597> of young men<WH970> is their strength<WH3581>: and the beauty<WH1926> of old men<WH2205> is the gray head<WH7872>.
The blueness<WH2250> of a wound<WH6482> cleanseth<WH8562> away evil<WH7451>: so do stripes<WH4347> the inward parts<WH2315> of the belly<WH990>. cleanseth: Heb. is a purging medicine against
